messages: 8d66ec8d38a6fa10a8b1bf7a6b8c9014 (06:37): hey ppl anyone alive
8d66ec8d38a6fa10a8b1bf7a6b8c9014 (06:37): have couple of hardware questions
8d66ec8d38a6fa10a8b1bf7a6b8c9014 (06:37): i know this is not the official sun channel but just was wondering whats the biggest hd i can put in my sun ultra 5

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:39): thats IDE?   what version of solaris are you running?  I'm gonna guess that anything prior to sol10 won't support LBA48 so 130GB is max.  but thats an uninformed guess.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:39): IIRC, adding ram to ultra5 is kinda sucky too.
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:40): its just expensive
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:40): well over here it is anyway
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:41): and not so easy to get, i had one with only 128meg in it, it was soooooooo slow, and couldnt find any cheap ram around, so got rid of it
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:42): Although i *think* its the same ram thats found in old compaq's or something like that
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:44): iirc, its an obsolete type of ram that noone makes anymore
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:44): and sun often spec'd different timings than were common in commodity ram
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:45): for instance, a lot of earlier Suns used FPM ram that was 60nS, while most PC stuff of that generation was 70nS

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:45): we had some U5's that didn't have enough ram, and it just wasn't cost effective to upgrade them so we tossed them out instead and got newer blade100s or whatever
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:46): yeah, crappy machines
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:46): unless you have a maxed out one or something

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:47): otoh, I'm keeping a couple Netra T1/105's running, they use a funky totally nonstandard ram module, but I scored a couple of them and both Netra's have 1GB, which is sufficient for our needs as a test/debug server for troubleshooting screwy things.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:47): as is the 440Mhz Ultra-IIi cpu
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:47): im actually lookinf for a couple of cheap U5's though, just to learn clustering on
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:47): as i can pick them up for about 20 pounds each
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:48): wanted U2's, but they seem to have gone to way of the dodo on ebay at the mo
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:48): thats what we originally got the two T1's for...
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:48): System Configuration:  Sun Microsystems  sun4u Netra t1 (UltraSPARC-IIi 440MHz)
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:48): System clock frequency: 110 MHz
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:49): i tossed our 3 U1's too :-/
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:50): they were just too old and slow, 160Mhz or something, barf.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:50): we used to run oracle on those :D
a151f5d5372661fd903498bc13d6098e (06:50): yeah, cant even chang the proc in those

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (06:53): so the sun side of my lab now has the two Netra T1's, a E450 w/ 4 x 400Mhz and 4GB and 12 internal drives, a v210 (which is our main developer platform now), and a v490 (which I'm still trying to debug the fiberchannel on)

8d66ec8d38a6fa10a8b1bf7a6b8c9014 (07:11): peerce: so i decided to ask here, so 130 is the limit... do you think it's hardware or software
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:11): um, I've never tried to run Linux on sparc hardware
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:11): only on commodity x86 stuff
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:11): AND I don't do debian... mostly we use RHEL and/or CentOS, occasionally SuSE.
8d66ec8d38a6fa10a8b1bf7a6b8c9014 (07:11): peerce: well i am using some specific software that i need some things that solaris does not offer those functions for me per defacto

8cd806e5c7f4f95937df692d3b8a3554 (07:12): you don't like things that are awesome?
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:12): karrot-x; dunno, just never gone there
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:12): its all the same shit with a different paint job
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:12): last I looked Debian wasn't on Oracle's supported environments list.  that pretty much rules it out for work.

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:15): rshakin; that statement didn't parse real well.  ok, you are using some specific software.  check.  you need some things that solaris doesn't offer?   you mean APIs or what?

0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:17): rshakin; afaik, the LBA48 thing is purely software/operating system, the ATA hardware is the same either way.   the linux kernel has to be 2.6.something to support it, I believe.   maybe a later 2.4.x has it, I dunno for sure.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:17): I -know- that 2.2.x doesn't :D
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:18): LBA48 is required for ATA/IDE > 132GB
8d66ec8d38a6fa10a8b1bf7a6b8c9014 (07:18): peerce: sorry english is not my language of choice, thanx :)

24340ef160b44f4e9d826263c6dd3188 (07:19): </Sammy Jackson>

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:26): Justin, what is the price difference between a  4 GB harddisk and 40GB disk?  about 50 cents?
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:27): actually, I have 2 320G drives coming to hopefully put zfs on :)
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:28): though the first test I did with zfs last night paniced the machine
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:29): what version? and what was the test?  did you file a bug report
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:30): was under nexenta.. I unplugged a usb drive while writing to it
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:30): installing real solaris 10 now to see if it does the same thing
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:31): that is a known bug...  and its being worked on.
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:32): ah, good to know:)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:32): the only good thing is that doing same thing on most other systems, would result in a corrupt filesystem along with a systemcrash.
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:33): Loading smf services descriptions sure takes a while:)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:34): longer on ATA drives or scsi cards that only have a 32 bit driver, and made even worse on zones that live on a ZFS filesystem.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:35): there is a bug that makes fsync calls on a zfs filesystem sync the entire filesystem instead of just one file.
a4a16fa360254e973a304a48ebe8fecd (07:36): yep, this is running on a test drive... some old 20G ata33
